text: <@U0ARUBWPK>: Sorry to hear that you're having a hard time, Reika. Would you like me to call you in a few weeks to see how you are doing and take it from there? Take care, of yourself and your dad.
<!channel>. I made a glossary for lifely. I think it's interesting for everyone: <https://github.com/OffCourse/glossary>

attachments.title: OffCourse/glossary
attachments.text: Contribute to glossary development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: <@U0ARUBWPK> sad too hear. hope you'll be back soon. we miss you

Hi Everyone,
Looking at all the work everyone has done over the weeks I feel really guilty that I have only done so little. I have been traveling to Utrecht a lot helping to take care of my dad and I have to say that it is a lot for me. Unfortunately I can’t make today’s call again and I am sorry to say that I need a short sabbatical to help take care of my dad and will be staying in Utrecht for a longer period. I just don’t have the physical and mental time and space at the moment to be intensively involved . We know that me taking care of my dad is not a long term solution and we are actively thinking of other solutions, a nursing home not being one of them. I know you guys can manage as I haven’t been involved very actively and hope to be joining you guys very soon. For now good luck to everyone and speak soon.
wow, looking pretty nice so far, esp the progress charts and overview

attachments.text: BasDobbelaer uploaded these designs on the 26th of Nov. Jump in here and give some feedback.

text: good survey. this is mandatory for students, right? otherwise, might lose people w/the whole ’10 minute’ thing (short attention spans)
<@U0D6EPESC>: thanks for your feedback. I was doubting though about slack and GitHub. Don't think students use these outside of CtH, but we can always filter them out if needed later, right?
<@U0ARRNM3R> looks great. I would add slack though (tool and/or channel)
(Keep in mind that they're university students .)
2. is there an important go-to source we need to add to question 4?
1. are there any other devices, tools and channels you can think of that people use when they're learning?
Looking for the following feedback:
<!everyone>: would you give me some feedback on the survey that we're sending out tomorrow to the students of Coding the Humanities? This is the link: <https://nl.surveymonkey.com/r/MW5XQ3J>
and <@U0D6EPESC> to read up on.
Hi <!everyone>, we're posting bullets about what we discussed in the call in the <#C0EA5U1QQ> channel for <@U0ARUBWPK>
Maybe I'll call you later this week, otherwise till next!
tnx for letting us know <@U0ARUBWPK>
HI guys, unfortunately I am not going to make the call tonight. I'll talk to you guys next week!
